# tabPlacement(_:)

**Instance Method**

Specifies the placement of a tab.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated func tabPlacement(_ placement: TabPlacement) -> some TabContent<Self.TabValue>

```

## Parameters

- **placement**: The location of the tab.

## Discussion

The following example shows a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/TabView] with three tabs where the second tab is pinned to the trailing edge of the top tab bar on iPad.

```swift
TabView {
    Tab("Home", systemImage: "house") {
        MyHomeView()
    }

    Tab("Downloads", systemImage: "square.and.arrow.down.fill") {
        MyDownloadsView()
    }
    .tabPlacement(.pinned)

    Tab("Browse", systemImage: "list.bullet") {
        MyBrowseView()
    }
}
.tabViewStyle(.sidebarAdaptable)
```
